author: j_d
title: Up in the sky
review:
This is one of my favorites of series 18 collectible minifigs.

This minifg is easy to feel for in the blind bag, beccause of the big suit.

There are star printings all over the suit and the word bang on the front.

The legs are printed on the front (obviously no printing on the back).

author: Master_Wu
title: KABOOM!
review:
This cmf is just like any other. He has normal minifigure parts with one special part on top. His torso is plain blue with red hands and his legs are gray with a little explosion mark at the top. The rocket piece is pretty cool but overall it is a pretty plain minifig.

I would recommend other minifigures first because the only main thing special about him is the rocket piece.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Explosions! Fireworks! Fun!
review:
Set #71021 Firework Guy: Celebration has included fireworks since they were invented, to celebrate and let the wider area see that you have succeeded in laying siege to the fortress... or something. I'm not a firework historian.

This guy seems to be ready for celebrating everything, unfortunately he can't explode; with a plain blue torso under a large costume piece printed with little star-shaped explosions and the word BANG on it, and with legs showing a print of the sparkling fire used to launch the rocket below the belt line this shades sporting dude is fairly impressive. While the new costume is something, I do kind of wish they'd included a sparkler piece for him to hold, even if it was the classic Castle era wizard's wand in a single trans-clear blue, green or pink colour.

I'd still recommend him from the set, but I'd suggest grabbing more of the unique and interesting figures over this plain-jane costume dude. Some of the other characters in costumes are decidedly much better designed. Recommended.
